Display

Parameter Set
.

Description
..

The parameter set "Display" allows to define a region-of-interest (ROI). The most common task is to gab the all pixles from the sensor. However, it might be useful to limit the image position and dimension to the ROI, which might reduce the nescessary badwidth on the PCI bus.

Some cameras have the ROI feature built into the camera. Using the cameras ROI has the advantage to reduce the bandwidth on the CameraLink cable as well as on the PCI bus. However, the ROI feature of the frame grabber is available within the microEnable IV SDK.


Parameters
.

Width

The width of the output image (not the camera image) in pixels.

Height

The height of the output image (not the camera image) in pixels.

XOffset

XOffset is the distance between the left edge of the output image and the zero of the camera image in pixel.

YOffset

YOffset is the distance between the upper edge of the output image and the zero of the camera image in pixel.

Max. Width

The maximum width is the maximum image width for the current applet which is setable in pixels. It just can be read out.

Max. Height

The maximum height returns the maximum image height for the current applet which is setable in pixels. This field is not editable.
.
